data.title: Westminster City Council
data.meta_description: We welcome filming and photography applications and our team is on hand to help you plan a safe and successful shoot.
data.text:
Private land

You do not need our permission to film within private property. Unless you require parking, your production is likely to draw public interest or there is an impact to public land. Please contact Environmental Health if you have any special effects or activity that may require a licence.

Location guide

Big Ben - streets to include in your application: Bridge Street, Great George Street, Parliament Square (south and east pavements) and Parliament Street

Chinatown - streets to include in your application: Dansey Place (LCCA must be consulted), Gerrard Place, Gerrard Street (Chinese Gate), Lisle Street, Macclesfield Street (Chinese Gate), Newport Place, Wardour Street (Chinese Gate)

Houses of Parliament - streets to include in your application: Abingdon Street, Old Palace Yard

River Thames - streets to include in your application: Waterloo Bridge, Golden Jubilee Bridge. Please see the non-council locations section below for information about Victoria Embankment and Westminster Bridge.

Soho - streets to include in your application: Greek Street, Frith Street, Dean Street, Wardour Street, Berwick Street, Broadwick Street, Beak Street, Great Marlborough Street, Ramillies Street, Brewer Street

Trafalgar Square - streets to include in your application: King Charles Island, Morley’s Hill, Trafalgar Square North Terrace

Non-council locations

Some public locations are privately owned or managed such as the Royal Parks, Trafalgar Square and Parliament Square. A list of some popular locations that are not owned or managed by the council are below. Please contact them directly for permission to film.

If you are filming a building or artwork in the public domain incidentally, please visit Film London for further information.

Buildings:

Royal Albert Hall: see Royal Albert Hall

Westminster Abbey Sanctuary and Dean’s Yard: Westminster Abbey

Land:

Abingdon Green/College Green (Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament): see Black Rod’s Office, Palace of Westminster

Buckingham Palace: see Royal Parks

Buildings (general): see Film London guidance

Covent Garden, Market Halls and piazza (surrounding streets are managed by the council): see Shaftesbury Capital

Birdcage Walk, Horseguards Road, Green Park, Hyde Park, St. James’s Park, The Mall and Victoria Tower Gardens: see Royal Parks

London Underground: see Transport for London

National rail stations: see Network Rail

Parliament Square Garden: see GLA

Red Routes,roads defined by a double or single red line, for example Victoria Embankment, Edgware Road, Westminster Bridge: see Transport for London

Regent’s Canal: see Canal & River Trust

Tower Bridge: see City of London

Trafalgar Square, main square (the North Terrace is owned by Westminster City Council): see GLA

Unit bases

Our unit bases are for large production vehicles that cannot park elsewhere including Winnebagos, toilets, catering vehicles and trailers. We provide separate guidance on unit base operations.

There are three locations in Westminster that can be used as unit bases:

Lincoln’s Inn Fields

St. James’s Square (weekends only)

Waterloo Place

You can book a unit base for a maximum of five days, including turnaround days. Spaces get booked up as much as three months in advance, so we advise booking early.

Please contact us to check availability, conditions and book.

Filming in the carriageway/filming with a vehicle

Filming within or from vehicles falls under the management of the Metropolitan Police Film Unit. You will not need our approval if all filming activity and equipment are contained within the vehicle(s) and the MPFU is content.

Other filming activities that will need review and input from the MPFU are listed in their guidelines:

Met Police Film Unit guidelines to filming on location
